text: The Order of Sports Merit (Hanja: 體育勳章 체육훈장) is one of the Republic of Korea's (South Korea) Orders of Merit. It is awarded to those who have rendered outstanding meritorious services in the interest of improving citizen's physique and national status through sports. ==Classes of Sports Merit== The Order of Sports Merit is conferred in five classes: # 100px Cheongnyong (Blue Dragon) 청룡장 # 100px Maengho (Fierce Tiger) 맹호장 # 100px Geosang (Giant Elephant) 거상장 # 100px Baengma (White Horse) 백마장 # 100px Girin (Giraffe) 기린장 ===Other Orders of Merit=== There are three kinds of decoration awarded by the Republic of Korea. They are Orders, Medals of Merit, and Service Medals. Korea: its Land, People, and Culture of all Ages, pp. 145-146. ==Select recipients== === Blue Dragon === * Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh - In 1985, Former President Chun Doo-hwan awarded Prince Philip to visit Korea as president of the International Federation for Equestrian Sports. * Guus Hiddink - Former Director of Republic of Korea Soccer Team 2002 FIFA World cup. * Yuna Kim - Former South Korean figure skater, Gold Medalist In 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics. * Jang Mi-ran - South Korean Olympic weightlifter, Gold Medalist In 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics. * Lee Bong-ju - South Korean marathoner, Silver Medalist In 1996 Atlanta Summer Olympics. * Thomas Bach - IOC President ==References== ==External links== * 체육훈장(體育勳章, Order of Sport Merit)_. * Republic of Korea's Orders of Merit Category:Orders, decorations, and medals of South Korea
